Question:
I want to see if there is any elementary way to prove the following assertion about matrices over division rings (such as not using Wedderburn's theory or tensoring techniques).

If an n×n matrix over a division ring has left inverse, then it also has right inverse.

The assertion has elementary proof for matrices over fields, but I am considering over division rings.

One can give some hints also.
Title: Matrix over division ring having one sided inverse is invertible
